column5: With BBR's entertaining report, I'm thinking of having a go at catfishing.  I've never tried it before.  What's the closest location to the GTA for channel cats?  Also, this might sound like a stupid question, but how can I tell the difference between a channel cat and a bullhead?  To me, ugly is ugly...
the internet is full of information, try google maybe? sorry i cant help as i dont fish for them, as u said, ugly is ugly lol

Thanks for the advice!  I tried googling first but couldn't find anything close.  I found Washago (Trent River) and Dunnville (Grand River), but both are a bit too far from Toronto.  It's weird how far I'll go for good Muskie, Trout, or Walleye, but for cats, especially my first time trying, I don't want to invest too much gasoline at over a dollar a litre.
yea i dont blame ya at all, where abouts are ya? PM me .. i am a good researcher
Check out this site....Its all in the TAIL.  http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/fish/catfish/biology.html
Well the site is in the states but it tells you what to look for as far as distinguishing between the diferent cats.  Like i said it really is all in the tail.  Cats are fun to fish for.

yea i have caught one before when i was fishing with my grandfather (rest his soul) i was about 11 years old and man, it fought me for a good 10 minutes as i was using like 8 # test on a mickey mouse pole lol .. mind u i didnt have to touch it so i have no idea how to handle the buggers...

LOL  You would be surprised at actually how many grown men will not touch a cat fish.......lol  I am often handling and removing hooks from catfish when the derby is on here in dover.....It makes me chuckle thats for sure.
